filter.description: hide specific temperature sensors, network interfaces, and disks using filters

flags.description: This group of options represents a command-line flag/option.  Flags explicitly added when running (ie: btm -a) will override this config file if an option is also set here

hide_avg_cpu.description: Whether to hide the average cpu entry

dot_marker.description: Whether to use dot markers rather than braille

rate.description: The update rate of the application

left_legend.description: Whether to put the CPU legend to the left

current_usage.description: Whether to set CPU% on a process to be based on the total CPU or just current usage

unnormalized_cpu.description: Whether to set CPU% on a process to be based on the total CPU or per-core CPU% (not divided by the number of cpus)

group_processes.description: Whether to group processes with the same name together by default

case_sensitive.description: Whether to make process searching case sensitive by default

whole_word.description: Whether to make process searching look for matching the entire word by default

regex.description: Whether to make process searching use regex by default

default_time_value.description: The default time interval in milliseconds

time_delta.description: The time delta on each zoom in/out action in milliseconds

expanded_on_startup.description: Expand selected widget upon starting the app

use_old_network_legend.description: Use the old network legend style

mem_as_value.description: Show memory values in the processes widget as values by default

tree.description: Show tree mode by default in the processes widget

show_table_scroll_position.description: Shows an indicator in table widgets tracking where in the list you are

process_command.description: Show processes as their commands by default in the process widget

network_use_binary_prefix.description: Displays the network widget with binary prefixes

network_use_bytes.description: Displays the network widget using bytes

network_use_log.description: Displays the network widget with a log scale

disable_advanced_kill.description: Hides advanced options to stop a process on Unix-like systems

retention.description: How much data is stored at once in terms of time

colors.description: These are all the components that support custom theming.  Note that colour support will depend on terminal support

table_header_color.description: Represents the colour of table headers (processes, CPU, disks, temperature)

widget_title_color.description: Represents the colour of the label each widget has

cpu_core_colors.description: Represents the colour the core will use in the CPU legend and graph

ram_color.description: Represents the colour RAM will use in the memory legend and graph

swap_color.description: Represents the colour SWAP will use in the memory legend and graph

arc_color.description: Represents the colour ARC will use in the memory legend and graph

gpu_core_colors.description: Represents the colour the GPU will use in the memory legend and graph

rx_color.description: Represents the colour rx will use in the network legend and graph

tx_color.description: Represents the colour tx will use in the network legend and graph

border_color.description: Represents the colour of the border of unselected widgets

highlighted_border_color.description: Represents the colour of the border of selected widgets

text_color.description: Represents the colour of most text

selected_text_color.description: Represents the colour of text that is selected

selected_bg_color.description: Represents the background colour of text that is selected

graph_color.description: Represents the colour of the lines and text of the graph

high_battery_color.description: Represents the colours of the battery based on charge

medium_battery_color.description: Represents the colours of the battery based on charge

low_battery_color.description: Represents the colours of the battery based on charge
